result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all felony convictions.
$140.00 paid previously towards attorney fees applied.
Defendant granted a payment plan to include all Clark County cases of $50.00 per month to begin 11-01-2015

Defendant granted huber privileges and credit for 35 days served. Jail sentence to begin immediately.

15CF05, Ct1, Felon Possess Firearm, 941.29(2)(a) and 15CF81 CT1&2 Bail Jumping , 946.49(1)(b) were dismissed and read-in to this case.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
